content:
Consumer Assistance in Florida

Contact your state department of insurance to get consumer help with a health insurance problem or question.

Medicaid in Florida

Florida has not chosen to expand its Medicaid program at this time. Read “What if my state isn’t expanding Medicaid?” to learn more. You can find out whether you qualify for Medicaid under Florida’s current rules 2 ways: Contact your state Medicaid agency right now or fill out an application for coverage in the Health Insurance Marketplace.

Shop Health Insurance Marketplace in Florida

If your small business is located in Florida, you’ll use an agent, broker, or insurance company to enroll your employees in health coverage. Enroll by the 15th for coverage that starts as soon as the 1st of the month.

Health Insurance Marketplace in Florida

If you live in Florida, you’ll use HealthCare.gov to apply and enroll in health coverage. Enroll by the 15th for coverage that starts as soon as the 1st of the month. Need more info first? Here’s what you need to know. Ready to begin? Select a button to apply.

CHIP in Florida

Florida KidCare covers uninsured children in families with moderate incomes that are too high to qualify for Medicaid. You can find out whether your children qualify for Florida KidCare right now. Fill out a Marketplace application and find out whether your children qualify. Learn more about Florida KidCare.
title: Florida
